intro: Erysimum nuristanicum, commonly known as the Nuristan mustard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of northern Pakistan and Afghanistan. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and broccoli. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are usually hairy as well. Erysimum nuristanicum is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in meadows and rocky slopes.
